label: Acidity
definition: the liveliness and crispness in wine that activates our salivary glands

label: Aeration
definition: the deliberate addition of oxygen to round out and soften a wine

label: Aging
definition: holding wine in barrels, tanks, and bottles to advance them to a more desirable state

label: Alcohol
definition: ethanol (ethyl alcohol), the product of fermentation of sugars by yeast

label: Anosmia
definition: the loss of smell

label: Appellation
definition: a delineated wine-producing region particular to france

label: Aroma
definition: the smell of wine, especially young wine (different than "bouquet")

label: Astringent
definition: tasting term noting the harsh, bitter, and drying sensations in the mouth caused by high levels of tannin

label: Balance
definition: a term for when the elements of wine acids, sugars, tannins, and alcohol come together in a harmonious way

label: Barrel
definition: the oak container used for fermenting and aging wine

label: Barrique
definition: a 225-litre oak barrel used originally for storing and aging wines, originating in bordeaux

label: Bitter
definition: a taste sensation that is sensed on the back of the tongue and caused by tanninsblend a wine made from more than one grape varietal

label: Body
definition: a tactile sensation describing the weight and fullness of wine in the mouth. a wine can be light, medium, or full bodied.

label: Bordeaux
definition: the area in southwest france considered one of the greatest wine-producing regions in the world

label: Botrytis
definition: a beneficial mold that pierces the skin of grapes and causes dehydration, resulting in natural grape juice exceptionally high in sugar. botrytis is largely responsible for the world`s finest dessert wines. (see "noble rot")

label: Bouquet
definition: a term that refers to the complex aromas in aged wines

label: Breathing
definition: exposing wine to oxygen to improve its flavors (see "aeration")

label: Brettanomyce
definition: a wine-spoiling yeast that produces barnyard, mousy, metallic, or bandaid-ish aromas

label: Brilliant
definition: a tasting note for wines that appear sparkling clear

label: Brut
definition: french term denoting dry champagnes or sparkling wines

label: Bung
definition: the plug used to seal a wine barrel

label: Bung hole
definition: the opening in a cask in which wine can be put in or taken out

label: Chaptalization
definition: adding sugar to wine before or during fermentation to increase alcohol levels. chaptalization is illegal in some parts of the world, and highly controlled in others.

label: Citric acid
definition: one of the three predominate acids in wine

label: Claret
definition: the name the english use when referring to the red wines of bordeaux

label: Class growth
definition: see cru classe

label: Closed
definition: term describing underdeveloped and young wines whose flavors are not exhibiting well

label: Complex
definition: a wine exhibiting numerous odors, nuances, and flavors

label: Cork taint
definition: undesirable aromas and flavors in wine often associated with wet cardboard or moldy basements

label: Corked
definition: a term that denotes a wine that has suffered cork taint (not wine with cork particles floating about)

label: Cru classe
definition: a top-ranking vineyard designated in the bordeaux classification of 1855

label: Crush
definition: the english term for harvest

label: Cuvee
definition: in champagne, a blended batch of wine

label: Demi-sec
definition: french term meaning "half-dry" used to describe a sweet sparkling wine

label: Dry
definition: a taste sensation often attributed to tannins and causing puckering sensations in the mouth; the opposite of sweet

label: Earthy
definition: an odor or flavor reminiscent of damp soil

label: Enology
definition: the science of wine and winemaking (see "oenology")

label: Fermentation
definition: the conversion of grape sugars to alcohol by yeast

label: Fining
definition: the addition of egg whites or gelatin (among other things) to clear the wine of unwanted particles

label: Finish
definition: the impression of textures and flavors lingering in the mouth after swallowing wine

label: Flavors
definition: odors perceived in the mouth

label: Foxy
definition: a term that describes the musty odor and flavor of wines made from vitis labrusca, a common north american varietal

label: Fruity
definition: a tasting term for wines that exhibit strong smells and flavors of fresh fruit

label: Full-bodied
definition: a wine high in alcohol and flavors, often described as "big"

label: Herbaceous
definition: a tasting term denoting odors and flavors of fresh herbs (e.g., basil, oregano, rosemary, etc.)

label: Hot
definition: a description for wine that is high in alcohol

label: Lees
definition: sediment consisting of dead yeast cells, grape pulp, seed, and other grape matter that accumulates during fermentation

label: Leesy
definition: a tasting term for the rich aromas and smells that results from wine resting on its lees

label: Length
definition: the amount of time that flavors persist in the mouth after swallowing wine; a lingering sensation

label: Malic acid
definition: one of the three predominate acids in grapes. tart-tasting malic acid occurs naturally in a number of fruits, including, apples, cherries, plums, and tomatoes.

label: Malolactic fermentation
definition: a secondary fermentation in which the tartness of malic acid in wine is changed into a smooth, lactic sensation. wines described as "buttery" or "creamy" have gone through "malo".

label: Mature
definition: ready to drink

label: Mouth-feel
definition: how a wine feels on the palate; it can be rough, smooth, velvety, or furry

label: Must
definition: unfermented grape juice including seeds, skins, and stems

label: Negociant
definition: french word describing a wholesale merchant, blender, or shipper of wine

label: Noble rot
definition: the layman`s term for botrytis

label: Nose
definition: a tasting term describing the aromas and bouquets of a wine

label: Oak/oaky
definition: tasting term denoting smells and flavors of vanilla, baking spices, coconut, mocha or dill caused by barrel-aging

label: Oenology
definition: the science of wine and winemaking (see "enology")

label: Open
definition: tasting term signifying a wine that is ready to drink

label: Oxidation
definition: wine exposed to air that has undergone a chemical change

label: Phenolic compounds
definition: natural compounds present in grape skins and seeds

label: Phylloxera
definition: a microscopic insect that kills grape vines by attacking their roots

label: Plonk
definition: british slang for inexpensive wine; also used to describe very low-quality wines

label: Rough
definition: the tactile "coarse" sensation one experiences with very astringent wines

label: Sec
definition: french word for "dry"

label: Sommelier
definition: a wine butler; also used to denote a certified wine professional. for a full overview go here: sommelier courses.

label: Spicy
definition: a tasting term used for odors and flavors reminiscent of black pepper, bay leaf, curry powder, baking spices, oregano, rosemary, thyme, saffron or paprika found in certain wines

label: Structure
definition: an ambiguous tasting term that implies harmony of fruit, alcohol, acidity, and tannins

label: Sweet
definition: wines with perceptible sugar contents on the nose and in the mouth

label: Tannins
definition: the phenolic compounds in wines that leave a bitter, dry, and puckery feeling in the mouth

label: Tartaric acid
definition: the principal acid in grapes, tartaric acid promotes flavor and aging in wine

label: Terroir
definition: french for geographical characteristics unique to a given vineyard

label: Texture
definition: a tasting term describing how wine feels on the palate

label: Typicity
definition: a tasting term that describes how well a wine expresses the characteristics inherent to the variety of grape

label: Ullage
definition: the empty space left in bottles and barrels as a wine evaporates

label: Vegetal
definition: tasting term describing characteristics of fresh or cooked vegetables detected on the nose and in the flavors of the wine. bell peppers, grass, and asparagus are common "vegetal" descriptors.

label: Vinification
definition: the process of making wine

label: Vinology
definition: the scientific study of wines and winemaking. also, the website for the wine school of philadelphia.

label: Vitis vinifera
definition: the species of wine that comprises over 99% of the world`s wine

label: Vintage
definition: the year a wine is bottled. also, the yield of wine from a vineyard during a single season.

label: Weight
definition: similar to "body", the sensation when a wine feels thick or rich on the palate

label: Wine
definition: fermented juice from grapes

label: Yeast
definition: a microorganism endemic to vineyards and produced commercially that converts grape sugars into alcohol

label: Yield
definition: the productivity of a vineyard

label: Young
definition: an immature wine that is usually bottled and sold within a year of its vintage. wines meant to be drunk "young" are noted for their fresh and crisp flavors.
